Class ec.ezlib.base.IndentWriter

                   +----ec.ezlib.base.IndentWriter
public class IndentWriter
extends FilterWriter
Wraps an underlying Writer, and writes all strings with "\n" replaced with ("\n" + prefix).

IndentWriter(PrintStream)
Deals with legacy
IndentWriter(Writer)
initial prefix defaults to nothing.
IndentWriter(Writer, String, boolean)
Returns a writer that wraps 'out', and writes all strings with "\n" replaced with ("\n" + prefix).

close()
Does NOT close the underlying stream, since that might be separately accessed.
indent()
morePrefix defaults to four spaces
indent(String)
Returns a new IndentWriter just like this one, but with morePrefix added on

IndentWriter 
 public IndentWriter(Writer out,
                     String prefix,
                     boolean autoflush)
Returns a writer that wraps 'out', and writes all strings with "\n" replaced with ("\n" + prefix).

If autoflush, flush()es after outputting each incoming newline. If prefix contains newlines (generally a bad idea), these do not cause a flush().

IndentWriter 
 public IndentWriter(Writer out)
initial prefix defaults to nothing. autoflush defaults to false.

IndentWriter 
 public IndentWriter(PrintStream out)
Deals with legacy

indent 
 public IndentWriter indent(String morePrefix)

 public IndentWriter indent()

close 
 public void close() throws IOException
Does NOT close the underlying stream, since that might be separately accessed. Does flush and invalidates this IndentWriter.
